reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Selected the hotel based on its rating here at Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. I emailed in advance to ask for an early check in and to request a patio room (you want your room to back into the court yard where the pool is rather than on the outside of the complex. Email response was quick , polite and accommodating on both counts !!
reviews.title: Great Choice on a Budget !

reviews.text: Upon our arrival staff was friendly and efficient. The rooms were a pleasant surprise overall having recently been remodeled. The only annoyance was a very loud air conditioning system with a condensation exhaust that flows into the bathtub from the ceiling. Drip....drip ....drip all night..... just close the bathroom door while sleeping. But that cold water will catch you off guard if you slither under its flow while taking a shower...
reviews.title: great stay highly recommend

reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was included in the room price... (breakfast was not spectacular offering just the basics - but it was enough to get you going.... the hotel also served a daily happy hour from 5 til 7 pm I believe with FREE wine and snacks... also free was FAST and convenient wireless internet - both in the room and around the complex.... topping it off was a state of the art, albeit small, workout room with moden aerobics equipment....
reviews.title: Lived Up To Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I was quite pleased with the hotel. I would recommend it and would stay there again... great job folks....
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: This is a smaller hotel set around a courtyard of very well kept and clean gardens and fenced pool area it has a real super feel about it. The staff are very friendly and very helpful we arrived and were allocated a first floor room, I then went back to change to a ground floor room as I thought this would be better for pool access for the children they changed the room no problem. The hotel provides a buffet breakfast included which is fine, cold juices and coffee seems to be available free all day and canapes are provided in the evening with complimentary wine and beer. The rooms are nicely presented and have comfortable beds with good amenities and a nicely appointed useable kitchen area with full size fridge freezer. Next door to the hotel are various shops and restaurants and with the amount of eateries in the Scottsdale area you are never far from a nice place to eat.
reviews.title: This is the best hotel stay I have ever had--anywhere!

reviews.text: I was really surprised to see how wonderful the suites were inside in person. Quality throughout and ton's of charm. Everything you would want in a five star hotel with an affordable price tag. The breakfast was a highlight of my day. Their blueberry pancakes kept me coming back for more. I would recommend this unique and stunning boutique hotel to any traveler. It's intimate, classy and first cabin. * * * * * (Five Stars)
reviews.title: A Jewel Box - Exceptional Boutique Hotel - WOW!!!

reviews.text: We were only staying here one quick night on the way to Sedona, but had stopped here to visit friends and family before heading out. The room was clean and had a nice kitchen with a full size refrigerator and microwave, but since we were only staying one night we didn't utilize it very much although it was nice to have to keep our drinks and ice packs cold before heading out.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for long stays

reviews.text: Breakfast was nice and served on real plates instead of paper plates and they had a nice drink reception in the evening with sodas, wine, juice, beer, warm snacks (it was egg rolls the night we stayed), and vegetables which was nice to have when we first arrived. My boys enjoyed the pool.
reviews.title: What a great stay at the gainey Suites!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was nice having the sitting area separate from the bedroom and 2 separate TV's. The one thing I didn't like about our room and I'm not sure if this is standard on all the rooms is there was a little PVC pipe sticking out of our shower that would drip water out every few seconds, I assumed it was from the air conditioning, but I have never seen anything like this before and it was very inconvenient to dodge cold dripping water when you're trying to wash your hair and also it was annoying trying to fall asleep with the dripping noise. It wasn't anything loud enough to wake us up, but we had to close the bathroom door and could still hear it. If I had been staying more than one night I would definitely have asked for another room.
reviews.title: Pleasant experience, comfortable accomodations, overcrowded pool...

reviews.text: We booked a room at the Gainey Suites in Scottsdale for the 4th of July weekend. They were offering a fabulous deal that we couldn't pass up. With ithe room rate you received a bbq dinner with beer wine and soda included, a clown doing magic tricks, balloon animals, and face painting, live music, and continential breakfast. They also offered fireworks a short walk away on a golf course.
reviews.title: Aware...Spa is 10 min drive to Double Tree Hotel.

reviews.text: hotel is within walking distance and next to the upscale shops, markets and restaurants of gainey village, an absolute advantage. discount coupons for 2 nearby restaurants (usd.20 each per seating) will be given at check in. unfortunately only 1lift available for the entire hotel. hallways may appear endless when your suite is on the opposite side. suites are great and spotless with a full kitchen and tv's for each room. only a few selected suites have balconies. pool is lovely but nothing special compared to the huge splash and plunge areas of the resorts in the region. hot breakfast is provided and good while we expected more from the evening hors-d'oeuvre. well, beer and wine is plenty and great restaurants are nearby. try "the kitchen". overall this hotel is a good choice, however look around, this region has so many great places to offer.
reviews.title: nice hotel in attractive area

reviews.text: We travel with a teenager plus disabled son (autism amongst other things) and our needs have to be very specific. Rarely have we found a hotel which met ALL our requirements. An excellently fitted kitchen is paramount to us. Slept like babies in the extremely comfortable beds. Great breakfast and free drinks. Peaceful, clean surroundings and fantastic pool. Staff great and very helpful. We have family in Phoenix and are encouraging them to recommend this place and we will definitely return.
reviews.title: Gainey Suites -everything we could need.

reviews.text: This was the third time I stayed with Gainey Suites and once agin they out did themselves. The rooms are clean, clean, clean. The beds are very comfey and plenty of pillows. I can't say enough about the service. Everyone from the front desk to the pool guy were very friendly and did their jobs well. The breakfast is as good as any resturant, and the evening snacks are enough you don't even have to go out to dinner, at least they were plenty for me. There is a van to run you to the store for yummies to put in the full size refrig. in each room. There is a microwave for heating, and a toaster. The pool is a mineral pool so there is are no chemicals on you, and your hair won't turn green. And FREE wifi!! I will be back in Az next year and I wouldn't stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Again!!

reviews.text: I like the Gainey Suites because... it's an all-suite hotel; the beds are comfy; the free breakfast is great; the location is perfect - in the heart of Scottsdale, within walking distance of shopping, dining, and a full service spa. It's perfect for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: This is a simple property with all of the perks of a full service resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed twice, 10 nights altogether. Beautifully designed suite with patio door opening onto landscaped quad with open air pool and hot tub and towels. Excellent cooked breakfasts and pleasant evening happy hours are included. Internet is complimentary, there is a business center with printer again included. Staff are especially courteous and always smiling - a really happy place and the chocolate chip cookies and teddy bear provide the class you expect at a boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Boutique bonuses - superb hotel

reviews.text: The room was very clean and the housekeeping staff were very considerate since we were traveling with 2 young children. We thought the room would be larger, we barely had just enough space for 2 adults and 2 kids. The 1 bedroom hotel room is more suited to just a couple traveling.
reviews.title: Good value for the money, but room is a little small.

reviews.text: I traveled during the summer, so I can't speak to staying here during the winter months. But for the summer, with special rates and promotions, the cost for a three night stay was less than you would pay at a Hampton Inn or similar hotel. The breakfast was delicious with plenty of options for even picky eaters, way beyond what you would get a standard chain hotel. The managers reception in the evening was great!! Wine, beer, salad, and vegetables with dip all complimentary. The king suite was fully furnished including cooking utensils, dishes, and silverware. The Safeway is only a few blocks away and you could easily pick up some groceries and set up housekeeping in the kitchen. Bring your iPod and set it up in the iHome docking radio in the bedroom. Okay, you getting the idea I like this place? You will, too.
reviews.title: Great value, beautiful grounds, comfortable spacious rooms

reviews.text: Looked at the the Westin Kierland before we booked. Had breakfast there and listened to people staying complain about small rooms, slow service and expensive food. Decided to go with reviews and stay at Gainey Suites. Check in was excellent. Gave us a patio room by the pool which was superb. Breakfast is excellent for an included meal. Free use of PC at reception was a plus for a son who loves Club Penguin. Real bonus was the free food, wine, beer and soft drinks between 5 and 7. We didn't abuse is but you could eat and drink as much as you want. Crudites, pizza, meatballs, chips and popcorn great. Lack of a bar, restaurant, concierge service which we never use does not both us. Especially when you have bars, restaurants and a bakery within walking distance. Final bonus was the free transport into Scottsdale. Cannot rate this hotel highly enough.
reviews.title: Great service, good location, great value not fussy and stuffy

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights on a Stay 3 nights, get one Free Deal. Included Full Hot Breakfast, Full Hot Dinner Hors' d'oeuvres, Beer, Wine, Cookies, 2 Teddy Bears, and two $20 Gift Certificates for McCormick & Shells Restaurant and Village Tavern Restaurant.
reviews.title: Couldn't be better!

reviews.text: Hotel was immaculately maintained, pleasant staff, luxurious accomodations, and all the comforts of home. Beautiful outdoor pool, surrounded by lush gardens.
reviews.title: Setting high standards of customer service ensures enjoyment of my visit
